column2: None but the highest and most powerful servants of Hashut can hope to master these hellish monsters.
None but the highest and most powerful servants of Hashut can hope to master these hellish monsters.
Chaos Dwarf Sorcerers have used Lammasu as steeds for thousands of years.
In battle Drazhoath leads his war hosts mounted upon the Great Taurus Cinderbreath, bringing fire and ruin down upon the enemy.
This black iron mace is inscribed with the ancient names of the founding masters of the Black Fortress, and has been balefully blessed by prophets to Hashut.
Forged from meteoric iron and blighted gold, this blood soaked and soul binding artifact is said to have been the twisted handiwork of the legendary sorcerer Azgorh.
This masterwork of Dawi-Zharr smithing is able to withstand attacks of immense power with and ease that would make any dwarf envious.
This hypnotically intricate black crystal amulet amplifies a thousand fold any hatred contained within the bearers heart, and channels that hatred into a dissonant aura of despair.
An unholy and horrific relic of the Black Fortress, this massive warhammer has seen many foes, and many wielders.
This suit of obsidian armour is fused with the remains of the long dead sorcerer, Zharbhark Hellion, imbuing the wearer's flesh with a stonelike resiliance.

First sent to the Black Fortress in effective exile, Drazhoath fell out of political power and standing, but has since risen to become its new lord through his innate cunning and bitter, ruthless ambition.

Tasked with overseeing all internal disputes and grievances within the ranks of the Immortals, Rykarth is swift and unscrupulous with capital punishments, though there is always time for some torture.
No greenskin would dare run amok in the presence of the Commander of the Tower of Zharr, lest they risk incurring whatever horrid torture Zhatan might be imagining.
Hashut's favour falls most on Drazhoath, for he is the chosen prophet.
Bringer of the Dark Father's vengeance, and seer of his ruinous plan.
Drazhoath's greatness draws in the mightiest of the Dawi-Zharr corrupted kin.
Bull Centaurs that fight with Drazhoath are of a different ilk, born of the darkest magics.
As the chosen prophet, Drazhoath's voice booms louder than any cannon.
Great clouds of ash or soot seem to follow Drazhoath wherever he goes, as though he were a walking volcano.
Rykarth's very presence causes the winds of magic to recede from him like an ebbing tide.
The aura that protects Rykarth from magics can grow so strong as to bestow the protection to those around him.
Accepting only the finest Dawi-Zharr warriors from the best trainers, just being a part of Rykarth's shield is a prestigious title amongst the fire dwarfs.
Only the finest arms and armour are fit for Rykarth's purpose.
The lure of the ungodly gifts from the dark father forges extends beyond any weapon or piece of armour.
A paragon of the resiliance and destructive power of the Dawi-Zharr, his followers and troops have reached a state of demi-god like worship.
Submission to the Dark Father or infernal oblivion. That is the choice Zhatan the Black offers, though most would find it not much of one.
A strong network of (relatively) healthy slaves requires a level of personal management that is beneath many overlords.
Through fear or hatred, Zhatan inspires a certain kind of fervour amongst slaves in battle.
Zhatan long ago learned the value of compensating his mercenaries well, more than loyalty can be bought through the corruption of avarice.
Employing tactics despised by even the cruelest of warlords, Zhatan is capable of turning peasants on their king through sheer fear.
Zhatan's infamy proceeds him by many a mile, and the sight of his vile war machines on the horizon exceeds all rumors.
Let it be known that Zhatan plunders to the west and returns with slaves for his master, Ghorth the Cruel.
